meanings.sent1: The little brother kept hassling his sister for a piece of candy.
meanings.sent2: Stop hassling me about cleaning my room; I'll do it later.
meanings.sent3: The persistent squirrel kept hassling the cat for its acorn.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the fly was like a never-ending hassling in the room.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet was a constant hassling noise in the quiet house.

meanings.sent1: The kids were hassling over who gets to play with the toy first.
meanings.sent2: They were hassling about which movie to watch, unable to agree.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully hassled each other about who was the better gamer.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued hassling over the budget, unable to find a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The siblings were hassling back and forth about whose turn it was to do the dishes.

meanings.definition: To engage in petty quarrels or disputes
meanings.sent1: The neighbors were hassling over the property line, each claiming more land.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were hassling over who ate the last cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside were hassling over the best spot on the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The students were hassling over who got to sit in the front row of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The dogs were hassling over the squeaky toy, each trying to claim it as their own.
